StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Mapping SLE heterogeneity at the single cell level

Person.Organization: JACKSON LABORATORYICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This study was made possible by generous financial support of the National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases (NIAMS) under award number P50 AR070594, the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) U19 AI082715, start-up funds from the Drukier Institute for Children’s Health at Weill Cornell Medicine (Dr. Virginia Pascual), and start-up funds from The Jackson Laboratory (Dr. Jacques Banchereau). The samples acquisition was made possible thanks to Drs. Pascual, Ramilo (generous financial support of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases award number U01AI131386) and Lakshiminarayanan, MD. The study investigators request that publications resulting from this data cite the dbGaP accession number phs002048.v1.p1 and the original publication of this research.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Autoimmune Diseases)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-ADO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Autoimmune Diseases.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
